alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 5:02AM PDT until August 21 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Los Angeles County. * WHEN...From 10 AM PDT this morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from expected heavy rain may result in flooding of creeks, roads, urban areas, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Of particular concern is the Antelope Valley and San Gabriel Mountains, where there is a high threat for significant and dangerous flooding especially on the roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical system Hilary will move over southern California and bring the potential for heavy rain and thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Avoid travel on Sunday into Monday, especially in the mountains and deserts. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley
